title: Why did Islam manage to spread in China but not Christianity? - Quora

response.answer_text: The current population of Christians in china stands at about 54 million people which is about 4% of the population why the total percentage of Musims in china stands at about 2%. Both this religions manage to spread to China but they are both under threat. You see the CCP is not really a fan of religion. Am sure you have heard about the whole Uighur education camp. As for Christians the Chinese government want them to put the CCP as an identity in the church. The CCP prefers to see it self portrayed as the leader of the catholic church instead of the pope. It also wants churches to sing the national item in church and hang a flag of china in churches. But one of this religions have a chance of remaining in china compared to the other, China is given Christianity a chance to remain if it adheres to its policies and follow censorship directives, for Islam not all that much given that the majority of them are ethnic Uighurs who are being taken to re education camps to counter extremism.

Come on, please ask if before why…  There are more christians in China than Muslims… Also, China has a larger christian population than all of Europe, except Germany, France, Italy, Poland, Spain and UK, resulting in China having the 21st largest christian population Anyway, unlike Islam which is mostly restricted to the native Uighurs ( Turks ) in western China, Christianity had spread into all of China and by the 19th century China had a huge christian population, but thanks to some heretical maniac who believed himself to be the younger brother of Jesus Christ ( no joke ) and started a rebellion ( → Taiping Rebellion ), where up to 30 million people died ( though some sources claim up to 100 million, meaning this would be the deadliest conflict of all time ), thanks to which the reputation of Christianity got tainted in China.
